text:
Dun-dun-na-na-na-na-na-na, dun-na-nee-nee,
nee-nee, nee-nee-nee!

Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today I’m gonna be making another recipe
from Game of Thrones.

I’m super excited, 1, because it’s Game
of Thrones, nuh-nuh, Game of Thrones
na-na Game of Thrones!
And 2, we have never made bread before.
I can’t believe it!
So many years, we’ve never made bread!

We are gonna be making the Direwolf Bread
that Hot Pie makes in the story,

the first time that you see this bread is
when Hot Pie makes it for his friend Aria.

And, it looks pretty ugly the first go around,
Aria jokes that she doesn’t know
which end is the head and which end is tail.

But, he makes it again next season, season
4, and gives a piece to Brienne of

Tarth, as a gift to show loyalty to the Starks,
and it looks way better you guys!

Second go around, Hot Pie’s Baking skills
have definitely improved!

So that is the recipe that we’re gonna be
making, let’s get started!

The bread recipe that we’re gonna be using
today is an Irish Soda Bread

recipe, I chose it because it’s very simple,
I thought it would be a great fit!

The things you will need, will be: 1-3/4 cup
buttermilk, 1/2 a stick of

ice cold butter, 1/4 cup of brown sugar, 4
cups of all purpose flour,

the zest of 1/2 of an orange, 1 egg, 1-1/2
teaspoons of salt and 1 teaspoon
of baking soda.
Now let’s put it all together!
Nee-nee, nee-nee, nee-nee-nee!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is mix
together our dry ingredients in
this bowl over here.

I’m just gonna be using my hands, I really
like

this recipe because, there’s no fancy equipment,
the…
Well I have a zester…

So you’re gonna add your flower, brown sugar,
salt and baking soda.

That’s why they call it soda bread, because
it uses baking soda.
And, fun fact, I’m a 1/4th Irish…

Irish Soda Bread, made by someone who’s
1/4th Irish, that helps.
Oh no I’m turning into a white walker!
Just kidding!

Now we’re gonna mix in our butter, I took
this right out of the fridge,

you want it to be cold, work it in with
your hands, keep doing this until it’s

well combined and you don’t see any chunks
of butter.
Now I’m gonna start working on the wet ingredients.

Over here, I’m just gonna take my egg, and
I’m crack it and just put
it right into my buttermilk.

Then I’m gonna take a little fork, and just
mix it together.

Now we’re gonna zest 1/2 of our orange,
usually when I zest an orange I just go

like this, but, because I’m gonna be adding
it to my buttermilk mixture,

I’m gonna be doing it upside down and it
will catch the zest on the back.
Hmmm-hmmm, hmmm-hmmm, hmmm-hmmm-hmmm!

Then we’re just gonna scrape all of the
orange zest right into the buttermilk.

We’ve got all of our wet ingredients mixed
up here and now we're

gonna add them to our dry, just pour them
in.

And then once again, we’re gonna be using
our hands, mixing up the dough.
Ree-ree-ree-ree-ree-ree!
Ooops!
Oh shoot!

It’s really sticky at first, but as soon as you
can make a ball, we’re gonna start
kneading it on the counter.

Got a little bit of flour, sprinkle it over
our work surface so that the
dough doesn’t stick.

Knead the dough for about 2-3 minutes until
it’s nice and soft,
I like to push, pull, and turn!

Kneading dough makes you nice and strong,
so you can fight White Walkers and
defend The Wall!
I’d make some bread for John Snow!
Call me Kit!

Our dough is ready, it’s nice and firm,
I’m just gonna place it into

the bowl, you also want to cover it, so I’ve
got some plastic wrap.

And let it sit for about 20-30 minutes to
relax.

Our dough is done resting and now we’re
gonna roll it out, I let it sit at

room temperature for about 20-30 minutes,
the first thing that I’m gonna do
is cut it in 1/2.
This recipe makes 2 dire wolves.
it could be whatever ones

you want, it could be like Ghost and Nymeria,
or Shaggy Dog and Summer, whatever!

I’m gonna roll the dough our about a 1/2
inch thick into kind of a
rectangle shape.

And now I’m just gonna take a little sharp
cutting knife,
and cut out the shape of the wolf.

I lightly traced into the rolled out dough
what the Direwolf looks like,
and now I’m just going to cut it out.

We’ve got our Direwolf cut out and I had
a lot of extra dough so I think if you

took the extra dough from this wolf and the
other wolf, you could actually get 3 of these!

Now I’m gonna add the design details using
a small cutting knife,

I’m gonna be cutting the fur, legs, his
face, and tail.

Then I’m gonna cut lines across his body
to look like fur.

This is what your little wolf should look
like.

I really like this bread recipe because it
will hold it’s shape, it doesn’t

have yeast, so it’s really gonna hold this
form.

I just placed them onto a baking sheet, lined
with a piece of parchment paper
so that they won’t stick.

Now we’re gonna brush our bread with a little
bit of egg wash,

over here I have 1 egg, mixed with a teeny
bit of buttermilk, just a little bit.

If you put too much egg wash on, it’s gonna
fill in all of your design detail
grooves, and you won’t be able to see them.

This will give it a nice, beautiful golden
color while it’s baking.

I don’t know if Hot Pie knows about that,
I’ll have to come teach him.
George, do you need another baking apprentice?
Plot twist, I’m Hot Pie’s sister!
Oh I think he’s an orphan…
Nevermind…

Now we’re gonna bake our bread at 350 degrees
for about 30 minutes.
Ta-daaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!
Here is the Direwolf Bread that we made today!
Look at it!

It looks just like the bread that Hot Pie
made!

I love this recipe because it is easy to work
with and it is the first time
that we have ever made real bread on Nerdy Nummies!

And it was very special that it was Game of
Thrones themed!

I’ll be taking lots of pictures and posting
them on Facebook, Tumblr,
Instagram and Twitter.

If you guys make this recipe, please take
a picture and send it to me!

I love seeing your baking creations, it just
makes my day!
Isn’t that right wolf?
Roof-roof-roof!

Also if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Merp-merp!
Owooohhh!

I’m gonna give this one to my Dad, and I’m
gonna taste one of these ones!

I’m sorry Summer, just gonna have a little
bite!
Mmmm-mmmm-mmmm!

I can taste just the hint of orange, it’s
so good, it’s not too sweet.

Oh I’m sorry Summer, I think I am gonna
eat you.
